meanings.definition: The quality or state of lacking a plot.
meanings.sent1: The movie's plotlessness made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: The book's plotlessness left readers feeling unsatisfied.
meanings.sent3: The play's plotlessness was so confusing that the actors kept forgetting their lines.
meanings.sent4: The plotlessness of the story was like trying to navigate a maze with no map.
meanings.sent5: The plotlessness of the mystery novel made it impossible to guess the ending.

meanings.definition: The absence of a coherent storyline or narrative structure.
meanings.sent1: The plotlessness of the film made it seem like scenes were randomly put together.
meanings.sent2: The plotlessness of the show made it hard to understand the characters' motivations.
meanings.sent3: The plotlessness of the play was so extreme that the audience started creating their own storylines.
meanings.sent4: The plotlessness of the novel was like a jigsaw puzzle missing half of its pieces.
meanings.sent5: The plotlessness of the documentary left viewers feeling lost and disconnected.
